result.execSummary:
All charges against Torrance L Jefferson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Torrance L Jefferson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Copy of minutes from PH Hrg on 7/20/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $10,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to the next in-person court hearing or the conclusion of this case. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not have any firearms within their residence. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Nancy U, Jonathan M, or Diego O. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

IN CUSTODY
Count 1 and 2 transactually related

Cash bond is set in the amount of $25,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to the next in-person court hearing or the conclusion of this case. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not have any firearms within their residence. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Nancy U, Jonathan M, or Diego O. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today.

01:36 PM Defendant in court, in custody from the Rock County Jail via Zoom with Attorney Jon Oliver Helland.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Defense moved to dismiss Complaint, made argument. Court denied motion. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Warrant vacated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
IA via zoom from Rock Co Jail
